intro: Trichodrymonia lineata, commonly known as the lineated trichodrymon, is a rare and unusual member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
